content.protection:
Standard desert, useful 1-2 pcs of 5", natural belay excluding last one below summit. No iron, hammer, drill on first ascent.

Descent 10' from summit to bolts on standard route. First rap 50', second 200' (from standard anchores) to the ground.
content.location: Middle of the North-East wall of Putterman in a Bathtub, straight to the top.

climbs.name: It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad Putterman
climbs.fa: Cameron Burns, Jesse Harvey, John Butler, 1999

content.description:
Pitch 1:Climb past a loose band to a splitter crack. Climb this to a small ledge, then climb a thin crack up and left to the shoulder and a belay.(5.10)

Pitch 2:Move right around the tower to the west side and climb a obvious courner to the top.(5.9)
content.location: This climb starts on the east side of the formation. To access, walk to the ridge on the north side of the towers and then 4th class along the east side of Putterman on the Throne to Putterman in a Bathtub.
